trans-unit.source: How to: Add Service Identities with an X.509 Certificate, Password, or Symmetric Key
trans-unit.target: How to: Add Service Identities with an X.509 Certificate, Password, or Symmetric Key

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Add Service Identities with an X.509 Certificate, Password, or Symmetric Key
trans-unit.target: How to: Add Service Identities with an X.509 Certificate, Password, or Symmetric Key

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: <newTerm>Service Identities</newTerm> are a type of credential configured globally for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> that allows applications or users to authenticate directly with <token>secondref_acs</token> and receive a token.
trans-unit.target: <newTerm>Service Identities</newTerm> are a type of credential configured globally for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> that allows applications or users to authenticate directly with <token>secondref_acs</token> and receive a token.

trans-unit.source: Service identities are used most commonly in REST web service scenarios using the OAuth WRAP protocol, where a client requests a SWT directly token from <token>secondref_acs</token> to present to the web service.
trans-unit.target: Service identities are used most commonly in REST web service scenarios using the OAuth WRAP protocol, where a client requests a SWT directly token from <token>secondref_acs</token> to present to the web service.

trans-unit.target: Contents

trans-unit.target: Objectives

trans-unit.source: Objectives
trans-unit.target: Objectives

trans-unit.source: Enumerate types of service identity credentials.
trans-unit.target: Enumerate types of service identity credentials.

trans-unit.source: Map credentials types to token formats and protocols.
trans-unit.target: Map credentials types to token formats and protocols.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: There are three types of service identity credentials:
trans-unit.target: There are three types of service identity credentials:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Passwords</embeddedLabel>—Passwords are used in plaintext token requests to Access Control Service using the OAuth WRAP protocol.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Passwords</embeddedLabel>—Passwords are used in plaintext token requests to Access Control Service using the OAuth WRAP protocol.

trans-unit.source: The password field corresponds to the wrap_password parameter in an OAuth WRAP v0.9 token request, where the username field corresponds to the wrap_name parameter.
trans-unit.target: The password field corresponds to the wrap_password parameter in an OAuth WRAP v0.9 token request, where the username field corresponds to the wrap_name parameter.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Symmetric Keys</embeddedLabel>—Symmetric keys are used in signed SWT token requests to Access Control Service using the OAuth WRAP protocol.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Symmetric Keys</embeddedLabel>—Symmetric keys are used in signed SWT token requests to Access Control Service using the OAuth WRAP protocol.

trans-unit.source: This symmetric key is used to create the HMACSHA256 signature in the signed SWT token presented to Access Control Service.
trans-unit.target: This symmetric key is used to create the HMACSHA256 signature in the signed SWT token presented to Access Control Service.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>X.509 Certificates</embeddedLabel>—X.509 certificates (public key only) are used to validate the signature of signed SAML token requests made <token>secondref_acs</token> using the WS-Trust protocol.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>X.509 Certificates</embeddedLabel>—X.509 certificates (public key only) are used to validate the signature of signed SAML token requests made <token>secondref_acs</token> using the WS-Trust protocol.

trans-unit.source: Summary of Steps
trans-unit.target: Summary of Steps

trans-unit.source: Step 1 - Add a Service Identity with a Password
trans-unit.target: Step 1 - Add a Service Identity with a Password

trans-unit.source: Step 2 - Add a Service Identity with a Symmetric Key
trans-unit.target: Step 2 - Add a Service Identity with a Symmetric Key

trans-unit.source: Step 3 - Add a Service Identity with an X.509 Certificate
trans-unit.target: Step 3 - Add a Service Identity with an X.509 Certificate

trans-unit.source: Step 1 - Add a Service Identity with a Password
trans-unit.target: Step 1 - Add a Service Identity with a Password

trans-unit.source: To add a service identity with a password credential type
trans-unit.target: To add a service identity with a password credential type

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Access Control Service</ui> management portal, click <ui>Service Identities</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Access Control Service</ui> management portal, click <ui>Service Identities</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Add Service Identity</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Add Service Identity</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter a name for the service identity.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter a name for the service identity.

trans-unit.source: This will be the username value used in the token request.
trans-unit.target: This will be the username value used in the token request.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the next page, click <ui>Add Credential</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the next page, click <ui>Add Credential</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Display name</ui> field, provide a value.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Display name</ui> field, provide a value.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Type</ui> field, select <ui>Password</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Type</ui> field, select <ui>Password</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Password</ui> field, enter a password.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Password</ui> field, enter a password.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Effective date </ui>field, set the date at which this credential will take effect.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Effective date </ui>field, set the date at which this credential will take effect.

trans-unit.source: In the <legacyBold><ui>Expiration date field</ui></legacyBold> set the date at which this credential will expire.
trans-unit.target: In the <legacyBold><ui>Expiration date field</ui></legacyBold> set the date at which this credential will expire.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 - Add a Service Identity with a Symmetric Key
trans-unit.target: Step 2 - Add a Service Identity with a Symmetric Key

trans-unit.source: To add a service identity with a symmetric key credential type
trans-unit.target: To add a service identity with a symmetric key credential type

trans-unit.source: On the Access Control Service management portal main page, click <ui>Service Identities</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the Access Control Service management portal main page, click <ui>Service Identities</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Add Service Identity</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Add Service Identity</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter a name for the service identity.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter a name for the service identity.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>

trans-unit.source: On the next page, click <ui>Add Credential</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the next page, click <ui>Add Credential</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Display</ui> name field, provide a value.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Display</ui> name field, provide a value.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Type</ui> field, select <ui>Symmetric Key</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Type</ui> field, select <ui>Symmetric Key</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Key</ui> field, click <ui>Generate</ui> to automatically generate a random 256-bit symmetric key.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Key</ui> field, click <ui>Generate</ui> to automatically generate a random 256-bit symmetric key.

trans-unit.source: Or, enter your own 256-bit symmetric key.
trans-unit.target: Or, enter your own 256-bit symmetric key.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Effective date field</ui>, set the date at which this credential will take effect.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Effective date field</ui>, set the date at which this credential will take effect.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Expiration date field</ui>, set the date at which this credential will expire.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Expiration date field</ui>, set the date at which this credential will expire.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 3 - Add a Service Identity with an X.509 Certificate
trans-unit.target: Step 3 - Add a Service Identity with an X.509 Certificate

trans-unit.source: To add a service identity with an X.509 certificate credential type
trans-unit.target: To add a service identity with an X.509 certificate credential type

trans-unit.source: On the Access Control Service management portal main page, click <ui>Service Identities</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the Access Control Service management portal main page, click <ui>Service Identities</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Add Service Identity</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Add Service Identity</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Display name</ui> field, enter a name for the service identity.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Display name</ui> field, enter a name for the service identity.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the next page, click <ui>Add Credential</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the next page, click <ui>Add Credential</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, provide a value.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, provide a value.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Type</ui> field, select <ui>X.509 Certificate</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Type</ui> field, select <ui>X.509 Certificate</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Certificate</ui> field, browse to load an X.509 certificate (.cer file) that contains the public key required to valid token signatures.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Certificate</ui> field, browse to load an X.509 certificate (.cer file) that contains the public key required to valid token signatures.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
